alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Camden, central Pasquotank, and Currituck Counties, the City of Chesapeake and the City of Virginia Beach through 645 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Deep Creek to near Northwest to Camden. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Elizabeth City State University, Kempsville, Regent University, Great Bridge, Deep Creek, South Mills, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Fentress, Cradock, Princess Anne, Back Bay, Indiantown, Northwest and Moyock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck
